titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: shewed me the house – a noble specimen of Elizabethan domestic architecture; I also looked at the parish church – a commodious building with a notable timber roof, and some fine monuments. Then I presided at a meeting of the clergy of the Condover Deanery. We discussed the
, which most of them had evidently not read! After the meeting M
Fielden entertained everybody at luncheon. Later we returned to Hereford, and arrived there about 6.30 p.m. M
Evill came to see me: and the Archdeacon of Hereford came to dinner.
